pullRequest.title: Exam participation mode
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) locally.
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context


First iteration of offline mode -> prevent that users cannot continue working on their exam if they loaded all application data (module.js) and have downloaded the StudentExam at one point
Description

Steps for Testing

Setup

Log in to Artemis
Create an exam with text exercises (currently only text-exercises and quiz-exercises supported, careful: you have to set a dueDate for each exercise as well), set a reasonable start and end date (you'll have to wait until it's over)
Add students/yourself to the Exam
Generate the StudentExams
Generate the participations and submissions
Navigate to the Exam (CourseOverview -> Course -> Exams)
Participate in the Exam by clicking on it

Navigate through exam

Accept the confirmation text and click on start exam-> A view opens with a navigation header + the first exercise of the exam
You can navigate throught the exam by using the navigation bar at the top
You can navigate by clicking on save and continue button (submitts current state and goes to next exercise)

Saving of submissions
Using header bar

Change the exercise
navigate to the next exercise, using the header bar -> submission should be saved to server

Using save and continue

Change the exercise
Click save and continue -> submission should be saved to the server

Automatic update every 60seconds

Change the exercise
Wait for 60seconds -> submission should be saved to the server
If a update is missed, because you were offline, the server should update it in the next cycle / the next time a save event is triggered (using header bar, using save and continue or after 60seconds)

SImple offline mode

Once loaded, the exam can be worked on even when you get offline.
Once you get online again, your last submission of each exercise you worked on is synched to the server (by triggering a save event)

Other

Check that the request time is displayed correctly
After the exam finishes, you should be navigated to the summary screen

Screenshots

nodes.bodyText: The StudentExam does not have participations. I would rather navigate over the exercises
I think we should not store the submissions separately. They are already part of studentExam.exercises.participations.submissions
do not invoke create (POST) here, we should invoke update (PUT)
do not invoke create (POST) here, we should invoke update (PUT)
do not invoke create (POST) here, we should invoke update (PUT)
file upload exercises are handled differently

I don't think this method should be necessary.
When the user clicks on start in the exam, the studentExam for the user should be downloaded with all exercises, participations and (for text, modeling, quiz) an initial empty submission.
(In the 2nd iteration, we can develop a fallback solution, in case one participation does not exist, then we would invoke startExercise on the server, when the student navigates into the exercise for the first time)
During the exam, there should be no need to load these objects again from the server
